Normally, for checks, only the Warning and Critical ranges are used: the colour yellow is associated with Warning, and the colour red is associated with Critical.

mal:item.comment: Indicates a nominal situation with no consequences.
Indicates unexpected behaviour without directly threatening consequences.
Indicates behaviour of serious concern requiring the attention of an operator, but not necessarily a malfunction.
Indicates that the monitored item has malfunctioned. Requires operator attention.
Indicates behaviour with mission threatening consequences. Requires operator attention.

mal:composite.name: ArgumentDefinitionDetails
mal:composite.comment: The ArgumentDefinitionDetails structure holds the details of an argument definition with a set of associated attributes, such as conversion used. The conditionalConversions define the conditions where a referenced conversion is applied. Only the first TRUE conversion should be applied.

mal:field.name: argId
mal:field.comment: Holds the argument definition identifier.

mal:field.name: description
mal:field.comment: Optional argument description.

mal:field.name: rawType
mal:field.comment: Holds the attribute short form part of the raw type of the argument, e.g., for a MAL::String argument it shall hold 15.

mal:field.name: rawUnit
mal:field.comment: The unit for the raw value.

mal:field.name: conditionalConversions
mal:field.comment: The conditional conversions to apply to the argument. Only the first TRUE conversion should be applied.

mal:field.name: convertedType
mal:field.comment: Holds the attribute short form part of the converted type of the argument, e.g., for a MAL::String argument it shall hold 15. Must not be NULL if a conversion condition is supplied.

mal:field.name: convertedUnit
mal:field.comment: The converted argument units.

mal:composite.name: AttributeValue
mal:composite.comment: The AttributeValue structure holds an Attribute value. It allows a list of different Attribute types to be created whereas List of Attribute would require the values to be all of the same type.

mal:field.name: value
mal:field.comment: The argument value. Must not be NULL. NULL may be represented by having a NULL in place of the complete AttributeValue composite.

mal:composite.name: ConditionalConversion
mal:composite.comment: The ConditionalConversion structure holds a condition expression to be evaluated to determine if a specific Conversion should be used. In the case that no test is required, i.e., the conversion should always be used, then the condition field should be set to NULL.

mal:field.name: condition
mal:field.comment: The expression indicates which entities are applicable for this check. If NULL, then the condition shall evaluate to TRUE.

mal:field.name: conversionId
mal:field.comment: The object instance identifier of the ConversionIdentity object to be used if the condition evaluates to TRUE or is NULL.

mal:composite.name: ParameterExpression
mal:composite.comment: The ParameterExpression structure represents a simple expression between a parameter and a value for that parameter.

mal:field.name: parameterId
mal:field.comment: Holds the object instance identifier of the ParameterIdentity object to be used in the expression.

mal:field.name: operator
mal:field.comment: The expression operator.

mal:field.name: useConverted
mal:field.comment: If set to TRUE the converted value field of the parameter value should be used, otherwise the raw value field should be used.

mal:field.name: value
mal:field.comment: The value to be used in the expression.

mal:composite.name: ObjectInstancePair
mal:composite.comment: The ObjectInstancePair structure is used to hold the object instance identifier of an Identity object with its associated Definition object.

mal:field.name: objIdentityInstanceId
mal:field.comment: The object instance identifier of the Identity object.

mal:field.name: objDefInstanceId
mal:field.comment: The object instance identifier of the Definition object.
